skillTree.localised_description: When the gnoblar horde goes to war, some bosses will ride atop another gnoblar in a "piggy-back" manner using their "pig-jousting" tactics to slay the enemy.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

skillTree.localised_description: Carried aloft by the strongest Gnoblars this Warthrone enables its rider to survey and bellow orders to their disorganised followers.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Sometimes an especially pompous or foolhardy Head Honcho will keep a Rhinox as his personal pet and do his best to hang onto its back as he guides it into battle, often shortly before being trampled to death by it.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: This one has guts – quite literally. A surfeit of stomach in fact, you might say, but also the confidence to back up his bulk.
Mountains of gold and an overflowing scrap piles are bound to draw in the strongest of warriors.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A small handful of Gnoblars surround this Head Honcho their swords always ready to cut and carve.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.
A Bellower’s voice is as deep as it loud, carrying across the battlefield and encouraging unbridled carnage.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Rule number one of being a leader is to be far more terrifying than the next braggard who thinks they ought to take your place.
This Gnoblar miraculously seems to avoid misfortunes that would see an end to other Gnoblars.
Often seen strutting around like they own the place and anyone that thinks otherwise is getting a beating.
After surviving the Pig-Joust and winning this Gnoblar is hailed as a Champion!
This Head Honcho is particularly great at stirring up trouble and insurrection within the Gnoblar society.
This one enjoys abusing his lofty and protected position by strutting around the camp bullying everyone and everything around him.
This one collects what he needs, forever on a quest to acquire the 'resources' needed for his collection.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%
This character can loot scrap piles
Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This one would rather just get drunk in his own camp – with no intention of going out.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though their intelligence is as pitiful as their physique, one would be a fool not to fear the Gnoblars when massed in numbers.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 for Gnoblars and Gnoblar Fighters units

Melee defence: +2 for Gnoblars and Gnoblar Fighters units

skillTree.localised_description: The more, the deadlier, the merrier.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: If there's one thing more horrifying than being rushed by a hulking, bloodthirsty beast, it's being rushed by Gnoblars riding atop each other in a "piggy-back" manner, using their "pig-jousting" tactics to slay (or at least irritate) the enemy.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +4 for Pigback Riders and Pigback Tossers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +4% for Pigback Riders and Pigback Tossers units

skillTree.localised_description: For all its slovenly appearance, the Gnoblar Scraplauncher is a devastating engine of destruction.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +5% for Gnoblar Scraplauncher units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +4% for Gnoblar Scraplauncher units

skillTree.localised_description: Even the biggest and most elite of their kind, like the Manbiters or Lucky Gits fight harder in the presence of a worthy leader.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Manbiters, Ogrebiters and Lucky Gits units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +2 for Manbiters, Ogrebiters and Lucky Gits units

Melee defence: +6 for Manbiters, Ogrebiters and Lucky Gits units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: What the monstrous creatures of the mountains lack in guile, they more than make up for in their stubborn reluctance to die.

effects.description:
Armour: +4 for Sabretusk Pack, Sabretusk Riders, Rhinox Riders, Yhetees and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +4 for Sabretusk Pack, Sabretusk Riders, Rhinox Riders, Yhetees and Giant units

skillTree.localised_description: To the most brutal, vicious killer go the richest spoils.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +12 for Gnoblars, Gnoblar Fighters, Manbiters, Ogrebiters and Lucky Gits units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Gnoblars, Gnoblar Fighters, Manbiters, Ogrebiters and Lucky Gits units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When pelting a helpless enemy with heavy projectiles is so much fun, why bother stopping?

effects.description:
Missile strength: +12% for Gnoblar Flingers, Trappers, Powder Sniffers, Rustbuckets and Gnoblar Scraplauncher units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Gnoblar Flingers, Trappers, Powder Sniffers, Rustbuckets and Gnoblar Scraplauncher units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When fearsome, brute strength is combined with terrifying speed, the petty weaklings among the enemy can only wet themselves in fear.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Pigback Riders and Pigback Tossers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Pigback Riders and Pigback Tossers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Pigback Tossers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Driven by ravenous hunger, the beasts feast on the flesh of the fallen.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for Sabretusk Pack, Sabretusk Riders, Rhinox Riders, Yhetees and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Sabretusk Pack, Sabretusk Riders, Rhinox Riders, Yhetees and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
One can never go hungry on a long march for as long as there are captives for the meat-pot.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Running a large camp is one thing. Running an effective camp is another entirely.
Raiders are good at marauding through enemy settlements - sending their denizens fleeing as their properties are despoiled.
Ravagers are merciless - they will sack an enemy settlement, take everything and kill any that get in their way.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
The grumblings of unrest tend to quiet when under threat of being crushed and eaten.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +25%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Well built, robust. Powerful.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +500 metres without incurring any time penalty

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A veteran of many pig jousting tournaments. A true hero of Pigbarter.

effects.description:
Attribute: Devastating Flanker for Pigback Riders and Pigback Tossers units
	(all units in army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +8% for Pigback Riders and Pigback Tossers units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "A Greenish-grey skin, yellow eyes, hates sunlight and looks like a fish? Yeah, this one is a Boglar, alright.

ui_effects.localised_text: Replenishes hit points of combatants when in water.
New combatants added when in water.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 when fighting at sea
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Don't let him bite you. You have no idea where that mouth has been.."

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Gnoblars and Gnoblar Fighters units
	(all units in army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Gnoblars and Gnoblar Fighters units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Used to be a flinger like you, then I took a pan to my nose and killed our previous boss. Good times"

effects.description:
Range: +10% for Missile Infantry units
	(all units in army)

Missile strength: +5% for Missile Infantry units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Though they risk killing the Ogres directly behind them, those fighters who like it spicy can propel themselves further with gassy emanations following a hearty meal.
The more meat you eat, the stronger and fatter you become, and therefore the harder you are to move from your chosen position.
There may or may not be a height difference between this one and his Ogreish colleagues, but in stature on the battlefield the divergence is most stark.
"Remember, lads, when Great Maw came 'e ate the night, shook the ground and burnt it with fire. That is 'oo we serve, not sum uvver power."
Once valuable scrap is acquired, this one will jealously guard it from rivals' eyes.
This one will only accept the most important looking or biggest Gnoblars in their armies.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +8% for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(own army)

Missile strength: +8% for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(own army)
